moves.1. e4 d6 2. d4 Nf6 3. Nc3 Nbd7 4. Bb5: This move provokes Black to play c6 and drive the bishop back.
moves.4... c6 5. Ba4 b5 6. Bb3 b4 7. e5: This was a good move by my opponent. I could not figure out what was the best reply. The sequence I chose won a pawn and seemed best.
This sequence has netted black a good pawn. But Black will have to be careful given White's edge in development.
moves.12. Ne2 Bg4 13. f3 Bf5 14. O-O e6: Black wants to get the bishop out and castle. But this blocks the bishop from the diagonal.
moves.15... Nd5 16. Ba4: ! This is where the game turns against Black.
moves.16... Rc8 17. Nd4 Ne3: ...Ne6? After playing this move I had planned, I started analyzing the results. I could not find a way to avoid losing after 17 Nxc6. So I resigned. My opponent suggested I might have played 16...Ne7 instead.
